homura.utils.reporters module¶

class homura.utils.reporters.LoggerReporter(callbacks: Iterable[homura.utils.callbacks.Callback], save_dir: Optional[str] = None, logger: Optional[logging.Logger] = None, report_freq: int = -1, save_image_freq: int = 0, image_keys: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None, save_log: bool = False)[source]¶

Bases: homura.utils.reporters.Reporter

Something like this

with LoggerReporter(...) as lr:
    trainer = ...
    for _ in range(100):
        ...

Reports like this

[homura.reporter|2019-02-30 27:31:20|INFO] [      1]                      loss_test 0.4413
[homura.reporter|2019-02-30 27:31:20|INFO] [      1]                  accuracy_test 0.8631
Parameters:
  • callbacks –
  • save_dir –
  • report_freq –
  • save_image_freq – If n>0, saves images every n iteration. if n==-1, every epoch. This may need large storage space.
  • image_keys – keys for images.
class homura.utils.reporters.Reporter(base_wrapper: homura.utils._reporter_backends._WrapperBase, callbacks: Iterable[homura.utils.callbacks.Callback], report_freq: int = -1, report_param_freq: int = 0, report_image_freq: int = 0, image_keys: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None)[source]¶

Bases: homura.utils.callbacks.Callback

class homura.utils.reporters.TQDMReporter(iterator: Iterable[T_co], callbacks: Iterable[homura.utils.callbacks.Callback], save_dir: Optional[str] = None, report_freq: int = -1, save_image_freq: int = 0, image_keys: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None)[source]¶

Bases: homura.utils.reporters.Reporter

Reporter using tqdm. Use like

with TQDMReporter(range(100), callbacks) as tq:
    trainer = ...
    for _ in tq:
        ...

The output is like

100%|█| 200/200 [1:01:10<00:00, 18.44s/it, loss_test=0.358, accuracy_test=0.919]
Parameters:
  • iterator –
  • callbacks –
  • save_dir –
  • report_freq –
  • save_image_freq – If n>0, saves images every n iteration. if n==-1, every epoch. This may need large storage space.
  • image_keys – keys for images.
class homura.utils.reporters.TensorboardReporter(callbacks, save_dir=None, report_freq: int = -1, report_params_freq: int = 0, report_images_freq: int = 0, image_keys: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None, save_images: bool = False)[source]¶

Bases: homura.utils.reporters.Reporter

Reporter using Tensorboard.

with TensorboardReporter(...) as tb:
    trainer = ...
    for _ in range(100):
        ...
Parameters:
  • callbacks –
  • save_dir –
  • report_freq –
  • report_params_freq – If n>0, reports parameter histograms every n iteration. if n==-1, every epoch.
  • report_images_freq – If n>0, reports images every n iteration. if n==-1, every epoch.
  • image_keys – keys for images.
  • save_images – If True, saving images in addition to reporting
class homura.utils.reporters.VisdomReporter(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Deprecated. Use TensorboardReporter instead.

homura.utils.trainers module¶

class homura.utils.trainers.TrainerBase(model: torch.nn.modules.module.Module, optimizer: Optional[homura.optim.Optimizer], loss_f: Optional[Callable], *, callbacks: Optional[homura.utils.callbacks.Callback] = None, scheduler: Optional[homura.lr_scheduler.LRScheduler] = None, update_scheduler_by_epoch: bool = True, device: Optional[torch.device] = None, verb=True, use_cudnn_benchmark=True, use_cuda_nonblocking=False, logger=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: homura.utils._runner.Runner

Parameters:
  • model – nn.Module or dict like {“generator”: gen, “discriminator”: dis}
  • optimizer – homura.optimizer.Optimizer or dict like {“generator”: Adam(lr=3e-4)}
  • loss_f – loss function or dict of loss functions
  • callbacks – callbacks or list of callbacks
  • scheduler – homura.scheduler.LRScheduler or dict like {“generator”: StepLR(10)}
  • verb –
  • use_cudnn_benchmark –
  • use_cuda_nonblocking –
  • kwargs –
is_train¶
iteration(data: Iterable[torch.Tensor]) → Mapping[str, torch.Tensor][source]¶

iteration part, user can override via duck typing or override_iteration

Parameters:data – data used during a iteration
Returns:loss, output
override_iteration(new_iteration: Callable)[source]¶

override iteration method

>>> def new_iteration(trainer, inputs):
>>>     ...
>>>     results.loss = loss
>>>     return results
>>> trainer.update_iteration(new_iteration)
Parameters:new_iteration –
